pageContext.claim: “You know, they said we did no legislative work. We signed 32 bills. ... Thirty-two bills. And they were saying a couple of weeks ago, during the 100 days, we signed none. Not everybody was saying that, but some were saying it. We signed 32 bills. That means went through Congress and signed it.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump had signed 28 bills as of his first 100 days. But as PolitiFact noted, the 28 do not appear to have required vote whipping from the White House. And none were significant pieces of legislation; many were to roll back a series of Obama-era regulations.
